result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshaun D Edmond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND THREE, EACH COUNT:  Concurrent to each other. Credit for 174 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules  of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously done, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any  election until his civil rights are restored.
$1,400.00 to victims  Anne Marie A.; $500.00 to Catherine L.; $1,900.00 to Jeri K. 13CM4362.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges and DNA surcharges, and restitution.  DOC to collect from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshaun D Edmond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing NOVEMBER 5, 2014, received and filed. (34 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION

Bond forfeiture order was pending restitution. Bail was reinstated and applied to restitution.
Copy of amended Assessment Report reflecting payment sent to DOC

Defendant Deshaun D Edmond in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Deshaun D Edmond in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. PSI reviewed.  Changes made to the PSI as stated on the record.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by victim, Jeri K.  Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Teri G, and defendant's brother, David E.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, concurrent to each other.
Credit for 174 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,400.00 to victim, Anne Marie A.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $500.00 to victim, Catherine L.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,900.00 to victim, Jeri K. (13CM4382).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* As to State Farm Insurance, Court set restitution at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Defendant Deshaun D Edmond in court with attorney Mary P Polenz.  Defendant Deshaun D Edmond in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 09-22-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Same conditions of bail release to continue.

Attorney Mary P Polenz appeared TELEPHONICIALLY, defendant Deshaun D Edmond not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Polenz is ill today.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Projected Plea Hearing.

for Deshaun D. Edmond (DOB. 12-07-1993).

Attorney Mary P Polenz in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant does NOT appear.
Atty. Polenz advised the Court that she does not know of the whereabouts of the defendant and does not have a working phone number for him.
Defendant has a report from Justice Point stating that the defendant has not been keeping in contact.
Statements made.
Based upon the non-appearance of the defendant, there being no explanation for the non-appearance, and the lack of cooperation with Justice Point, Court ORDERED a bench warrant to issue.
Court ordered the $750.00 cash bail on deposit FORFEITED subject to any restitution claim.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
